svg.title: Stage of process for installation of flue gas desulphurization in India
svg.desc: Created by Robbie Andrew (@robbie_andrew), CICERO Center for International Climate Research. CC-BY: Material may be freely re-used as long as you credit the author

g.text: Stage of process for installation of flue gas desulphurization in India

text.tspan: In December 2015, India introduced new requirements for coal-fired power stations to
install flue gas desulphurization (FGD), with a deadline of 7 December 2017. When it
became clear this would not be achieved, the deadline was pushed back to 2022. In
September 2022 it was again pushed back to 2024.
As of August 2024, 19.4 GW of a total 217.6 GW
of coal power had FGD installed.

div.p: CC-BY: Material may be freely re-used as long as you credit the author
